N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 18.2 - Special provisions for counties

State Regulations

If generally authorized by a local law of the county
legislative body, and by resolution of the legislative body of the local
authority involved, an officer, department or other agency of county government
may contract with any local authority within the county for the purpose of
removing and disposing of abandoned vehicles. In such event, the officer, department or other agency of the county involved shall be the agent of the
local authority while removing and disposing of vehicles abandoned within the
jurisdiction of such local authority. Any monies derived from the sale of such
abandoned vehicles, less the expense of removal and sale, shall be held by the
county for a period of one year and thereafter paid into the general fund of
the county in the same manner as if the county were the local authority
entitled to the custody of the vehicle, as prescribed by subdivision 6 of
section
1224
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Notes
